2013-03-10 17:36:04Sal Scotto <sal.scotto@gmail.com>morphia/src/main/java/com/github/jmkgreen/morphia/converters/ByteConverter.java v 478408d6c8a6ce8b97093751e2270c47bfbeba05

fix for issue #30
The Java driver will automatically wrap a byte[] array as a Binary bson
type.
the decoder only checked for Number and failing that used toString and
tried to make that a arrya of bytes. It was missing the check to see if
the input obejct was a Binary wrapper and call its getData method
2013-03-10 16:33:31Sal Scotto <sal.scotto@gmail.com>morphia/src/main/java/com/github/jmkgreen/morphia/mapping/DefaultMapper.java v f88f813667a30356ae6b26b48f40ce08de9884fd

morphia/src/main/java/com/github/jmkgreen/morphia/mapping/Mapper.java v f88f813667a30356ae6b26b48f40ce08de9884fd

Default mapper will now raise a concurrent modification exception if you
try to cache a class a second time. The MappedClass will log this error
so previous expectations are the same on the code. A later review should
be done to determine if the exception should propagate out and stop
operations.

Update Mapper to be more friendly to subclasses.

private functions are now protected so someone overriding a few methods
can access those methods.

moved a few fields from the Mapper to

MapperOptions added BasicDBList to ReflectionUtils.

Adjusted MappedClass to use a Mapper interface instead of DefaultMapper
